Juniors & Seniors - Info Needed in Emails!

	

6

	
	

Move On to This Month's Lesson

	

Next Category

Your 1st Email
Getting Started!

 

Layout
Sentence 1: About You - Name, Grad Year, Hometown & State, Team, Positions
Sentence 2: Why are you interested in the school academically (be specific)
Sentence 3: Why are you interested in the softball program (or fun fact)

Example:
SUBJECT: What makes you Special as a Player 
**Do not put your name/grad year - put why they should recruit you**

Coach _____, Coach_____, Coach______,

            Hi, my name is Rachel Coleman (2024) from Pennsville, NJ and I am a pitcher/2B for EC Bullets Coleman. I am interested in the University of Delaware because you have the number 1 PT school in the country and that is what I would like to study! Also, congratulations on a 19-4 start to your 2020 season. I am excited to watch your team grow in 2021!

Name (Grad Year)
Team #
Twitter: (Make sure it is a link)

Travelball Coach Info (Name, Email & Phone)

Schedule (written out so they can search it on their email accounts)

**Always include a SHORT video that makes them want to come back for more

 

Email Secrets:
 - College Coaches watch your video before they read your email
 - Video gets you put on the list or taken off (make sure its wow omg - I have to have this kid video)
 - All emails should include a video clip
 - Always forward your last email back to the coaches (so there is a chain of emails)
 - Keep emails to 3-4 sentences MAX
 - Follow the Monthly Lesson on how much you should be emailing

Complete
 
Great Job! Keep Going!
Twitter Email Next Lesson 
Comments   0

Twitter Email
Getting Started!

Twitter Email:
Sentence 1: Something specific about the school and what is going on in their program currently (show that you are following their school on social media)
Sentence 2: Invite the coach to follow you on Twitter for progress and updates

Example 1: 
I hope everyone is staying safe and healthy during the holiday season. I wanted to invite you to like my twitter page (@sballrecruiting) so you can follow my progress as a player and person! 

Example 2:
Congrats on a great fall season!! I have followed and watched your practices on Facebook (showing you are seriously interested and following their program). I wanted to take a moment to invite you to like my twitter page (@sballrecruiting) so you can follow my winter training progress!


 

Mark As Complete
 
Great Job! Keep Going!

Next Category

Juniors & Seniors - Info Needed in Emails!
Getting Started!

Example 1: I'd love to talk with you more about your softball program and academics at the University of Delaware. Feel free to call me anytime (000) 000-0000

Example 2: If you have a moment, I would like to talk to you more about how I can help your softball program. My cell phone number is: (000) 000-0000 .

REMEMBER: College coaches cannot talk to you until...
DI Coaches: September 1 of your Junior Year
DII Coaches: June 15 after your Sophomore Year 
DIII Coaches: Anytime you are in HS (typically recruit later though - JR & SR)
NAIA Coaches: Anytime you are in HS (typically recruit later though - JR & SR)
JUCO - Junior Colleges: Anytime you are in HS (typically recruit later though - JR & SR)

Turn Emails into Phone Calls and Phone Calls into Offers! 
https://www.softballrecruiting.com/offers/jm5dNidk

Email Winter Training Plan - GET CREATIVE!

Coach _____, Coach _______ & Coach _______,

I hope you had a great Thanksgiving with family & friends. We had a great thanksgiving ________(something specific you did). Currently, my team is __________ (team plan) and I have been coming up with a winter training plan in order to (what are you going to get better at)? Please see blow for my winter training plan.

Please do not hesitate to reach out to my coach with any questions!

Name (Grad Year)
Team (Number)
Twitter

Coaches Information (Name, Cell & Email)

*ATTACH BEST VIDEO

 

Merry Christmas Email (Schedule Send - Create Graphic)

Happy New Year Email (Schedule Send - Create Graphic)

5:03
	
Camps & Clinics
	
1 Lesson

	
	

Camp/Clinic Protocol

	

Next Category

Camp/Clinic Protocol
Camps & Clinics

Process:

1. Email 4 Days Before

2. Ask Softball Question

3. END: Ask Academic Question

4. Picture 

5. Post on Social Media (Tag Coaches & Schools)

6. Thank You Email

 

Email 4 Days Before:

AT a Neutral Site:

I hope you are enjoying your summer! am excited to attend the __________ Clinic at _______. Hopefully, I get the chance to work with you!

I have attached my video & schedule below for the tournament following the clinic. 

Please contact my coach if you have any further questions:

Name (grad year)
Team name #
Twitter or Cell

(SCHEDULE - LINK TO TOURNAMENT)

ON THEIR CAMPUS:

I hope you are enjoying your summer! am excited to attend your clinic and learn more about (Mascot) Softball Program.  

I have attached my video from this weekend. My stats: _____________

Please contact Coach ____ if you have any further questions:

See you soon!!

Name (grad year)
Team name #
Twitter or Cell

 

Thank You Email

I just wanted to take a minute, and thank you for a great camp!! (Thank them for what they showed you specifically softball wise). (Thank them for answering you academic question).

I hope to see you at some of our games this summer!!

Name (grad year)
Team name #
Twitter or Cell

(Attach Picture)

 

Recruiting Card Info:

Information on Recruiting Cards: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m6QLT6FSHNg

 
 
No Team Logo:

https://verifiedink.us/create?team_drop_id=20&drop_type=gated&code=pattyo

Next Category

Emails/Texts
How to Prepare for September 1!

Emails/Text Templates:

(1st/2nd Week of August)

Hey Coach ____, Coach _____, Coach _____,

I hope everyone is staying Healthy. My highlighted stats this summer include: ___________ (Put your BEST Stats whether it is a weekend or Season Stats). Next year, 1. I am excited to stay with _______ team. or 2. I will be playing for _________ (new team name). September 1 is coming and I am excited to learn more about you, your softball program and _____ (School Name) academics. 

 

If you could please send your contact information to my travel ball coach (Name, Email & Cell), I would appreciate it!
**Only if you and your travel ball coach do not have it***

Go ________ (Mascot)!! Talk soon!

Name - Grad Year
Team - #
Cell: 
Twitter:

 

1 Week before September 1 (or contact date):

Coach ____, Coach ___, & Coach ______,

I hope everyone is staying healthy this fall! ________ University/College (School Name) is at the top of my list because of _______ (do your homework - later section). I love your softball program because of _________ (do your homework - later section). 

I am excited for September 1 and hope to hear from your coaching staff. Please feel free to contact me anytime (after September 1 of course)! Cell: 

Go _______ (Mascot)!! Talk soon!

Name - Grad Year
Team - #
Cell: 
Twitter:

 

August 31 Text:

Hey Coach _____. Its (Name) - (Grad Year - Position - Team. Name). I am excited to be able to talk to you about _______ University/College & softball program tomorrow! Name (grad year)
